books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: A deeply personal account from the former First Lady of the United States, chronicling her life from childhood through to her time in the White House.
books.title: Becoming

books.author: Paul Kalanithi
books.description: A memoir of Paul Kalanithi, a neurosurgeon at Stanford University, who faced terminal lung cancer.
books.title: When Breath Becomes Air

books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: A memoir of a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.
books.title: Educated

books.author: Jeannette Walls
books.description: A memoir depicting the author's unconventional upbringing with parents who were often homeless and her eventual rise to success.
books.title: The Glass Castle

books.author: Cheryl Strayed
books.description: A memoir chronicling the author's solo hike along the Pacific Crest Trail as she grapples with grief, healing, and self-discovery.
books.title: Wild

books.author: Malala Yousafzai
books.description: The memoir of Malala Yousafzai, the Pakistani girl who stood up to the Taliban for her right to education and became a global advocate for girls' education.
books.title: I Am Malala

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir by comedian Trevor Noah, detailing his childhood growing up in apartheid South Africa and his journey to becoming the host of The Daily Show.
books.title: Born a Crime

books.author: Anthony Bourdain
books.description: A memoir by the renowned chef and television personality, sharing his experiences in the culinary world and his travels.
books.title: Kitchen Confidential

books.author: Patti Smith
books.description: A memoir by musician and artist Patti Smith, recounting her early life, rise to fame in the New York City art scene, and relationship with Robert Mapplethorpe.
books.title: Just Kids

books.author: J.D. Vance
books.description: A memoir exploring the author's upbringing in a working-class family in Appalachia and his reflections on social and economic issues in America.
books.title: Hillbilly Elegy

books.author: Elizabeth Gilbert
books.description: A memoir chronicling the author's year-long journey of self-discovery and spiritual exploration across Italy, India, and Indonesia.
books.title: Eat, Pray, Love

books.author: Augusten Burroughs
books.description: A memoir detailing the author's unconventional and often tumultuous upbringing, marked by his mother's mental illness and his experiences in foster care.
books.title: Running with Scissors

books.author: Jeanette Winterson
books.description: A memoir by British author Jeanette Winterson, exploring her tumultuous relationship with her adoptive mother and her journey to self-acceptance as a lesbian.
books.title: Why Be Happy When You Could Be Normal?

books.author: Joan Didion
books.description: A memoir by Joan Didion, reflecting on her experiences living in California during the 1960s and grappling with personal tragedy.
books.title: The Year of Magical Thinking

books.author: Helen MacDonald
books.description: A memoir recounting the author's experience of grief and her journey to healing through falconry after the death of her father.
books.title: H Is for Hawk

books.author: Gabrielle Hamilton
books.description: A memoir by chef Gabrielle Hamilton, detailing her unconventional path to becoming a chef and her experiences running a restaurant.
books.title: Blood, Bones & Butter

books.author: Barack Obama
books.description: The memoir of Barack Obama, the 44th President of the United States, covering his early life, political career, and presidency.
books.title: A Promised Land

books.author: Bryan Stevenson
books.description: A memoir by lawyer and social justice advocate Bryan Stevenson, detailing his work challenging racial injustice and mass incarceration in America.
books.title: Just Mercy

books.author: Jung Chang
books.description: A memoir by Chinese-British author Jung Chang, recounting her experiences growing up during the Cultural Revolution in China and her journey to becoming a writer.
books.title: Wild Swans

books.author: Craig Thompson
books.description: A graphic memoir by Craig Thompson, exploring his upbringing in a conservative Christian family and his struggles with faith, sexuality, and identity.
books.title: Blankets
